column1: # The CSV should have the following fields for each media clip

column2: tags to be added to the media. Multiple tags can be assigned using double quotation marks for the entire field
column3: and commas to separate between tags. For example: “ tag  1

column2: the URL from which the media is to be pulled.

column1: #         Kaltura supports the following protocols: http
#         In addition Kaltura supports user:password additions into the URL in the following format:

column2: must be one of the following: video

column1: #  -  Transcoding Profile ID – optional. Allows the user to specify the transcoding profile that will define the specific transcoding of the file.  If left blank
column2: the system will use the default transcoding profile. If the ID does not exist
column3: then the entry will be skipped and an error will be logged.

column1: #  -  Access Control Profile ID - optional. Allows the user to specify the Access Control Profile for each entry. If left blank
column2: the system will use the default profile. If the ID does not exist
column3: then the entry will be skipped and an error will be logged.

column2: if the category specified does not exist in the system

column1: #         Multiple categories can be assigned using double quotation marks for the entire field
column2: and commas to separate between categories.

column1: #         Categories hierarchy can be created using the ‘greater than’ sign.
#         Date format is based on ISO 8601 using the YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss format where the capital letter T is used to separate the date and time components.

#         Example: 2003-04-01T13:01:02 represents one minute and two seconds after one o'clock in the afternoon of 2003-04-01.  For further information please refer to : http://www.iso.org/iso/date_and_time_format#how-it-works

column2: can be left blank. See Start Date for date format.
will pull the image from the URL and set it as the entry’s thumbnail. If left blank the system will take a frame from 5 seconds into the video.

column1: #         Arbitrary data that may be relevant for this entry
column2: stored in Partner Data column. This data is not exposed in the KMC
column3: and can currently only be retrieved via API.
